Dialogue: Question, sir?   His untiring pen predicted the airplane, the submarine, the bicycle, the helicopter, and even the tank.

Dialogue: Come on, this stuff will knock you out.  Have you ever had the feeling you were being followed, Mr. Bond.

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: Never, why do you ask?

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: Whoa.  Name's Hawkins, Eddie Hawkins. My nickname's Hudson Hawk, but don't call me Hudson, not even as a joke. The Nuns at St. Agnes called me that and they're the ones who helped make me what I am today. Not a compliment...

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Sure Hudson.  Are you going to tell me why you did that back there or are you going to blame it on Dumbo?

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: Could you believe that crazy elephant?

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: Whoa, part 2.  Does it go to Times Square?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Delivers up to ten at night.  The Pope has an obsession with his Easter Seals.  It's actually not that an unusual set-up.  The secret passageway on the other hand....

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: The Vatican is made of constant mysteries meant to be enjoyed, not explained.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Nice.  But right out of our brochure.

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: Oh, you read that.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Actually I wrote it.  It's a good sentence.  It can apply to people.

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: You're not an unmysterious thang yourself.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: I don't steal stuffed elephants from little girls.  And I buy my own clothes.  My life's a little boring...

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: God, I wish I could say the same thing.  What about having a nice, dull dinner with me tonight. Scrabble, Knock-knock jokes, Anecdotes about famous dead Italians....

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: I'll bring my entire repertoire...

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: And I'll bring my entourage...

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Secret passageways don't mean as much as they used to.  There's a place two blocks east of here.

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: Said.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Father, it's obvious.  He's up to something.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: cardinal
Dialogue: Did he mention the Mayflowers?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: No, your Eminence.  I think he's going to steal the Codex, as early as next week.

Speaker: cardinal
Dialogue: Attempt, you mean.  The vanity of this man, Hudson Hawk.  The Vatican has foiled the advances of Pirates and Terrorists.  We will not lie down for some schmuck from New Jersey.  Must you flirt with him so realistically?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: That's the best kind.  A wise woman once said "Polite conversation is rarely either."

Dialogue: Let me be the one to quote Scripture.  ....As an agent of our organization, you are put in awkward situations.  Just remember, Hudson Hawk is an evil, evil man.

Dialogue: Yeah.  The big E.

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: Hello, operator.  I'd like to make a collect call to New York number...

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: Thank you, operator, thank you.

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: Come on, Alex, pick up, you Reindeer goat cheese-eating motherfucker.

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: A-lex, A-lex, come on Alex.

Speaker: kaplan
Dialogue: Hawk, Hawk, Hawk.  Enjoying Italy?  I always had a soft spot for Rome.  Did my first barehanded strangulation here.  Communist politician.

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: Why George, you big softie...

Speaker: kaplan
Dialogue: God, I miss communism.  The Red Threat.  People were scared, the Agency was respected, and I got laid every night.

Speaker: butterfinger
Dialogue: Sorry, coach...

Speaker: kaplan
Dialogue: If his father wasn't the head of Shit, I hate this, the government's got me farmed out, working for the Mayflower corporation now, money beats politics.  War isn't Hell anymore, it's Dull.  Don't slaughter their men and rape their women, just steal their microchips.

Speaker: hawk
Dialogue: You know Kaplan, if you weren't the slimiest pinata of shit that ever lived, I'd feel sorry for you.

Dialogue: Snickers, make the list happen. Oh and it's one thing to play hide and seek with the Mayflower's pathetic staff, but we're sore losers.  I've put jumper cables on the nipples of children and not always in the line of duty.

Dialogue: If you do anything to my friend...

Dialogue: What did you have against Little Eddie, motherfucker?  He was just a monkey who liked to laugh. Come back without your yuppie army.  I'll triscuit you, you space shuttle eating...Shit.!

Dialogue: "Beware the Odd Steps."

Dialogue: Italy, France, Moscow.  They all just wanna be Nebraska.  Old Man Kaplan thinks since Communism is dead, we got nothing to do.  Man, Democracy isn't free elections. Dialogue: Somebody robbed the Vatican.

Dialogue: Oh.  No.

Dialogue: Wha--

Dialogue: Anna, what are you trying to say...

Dialogue: He came into a world where crime is a legitimate business tactic and a legitimate government procedure.  But he knew Right and Wrong.  Oh, and we kind of messed around...

Dialogue: "Messed around" messed around?  I know-- I don't want to know.  First base?  Second Base?  Stop me when I'm getting warm...

Dialogue: Sorry.  Seventeen Hail Marys and five minutes outside.

Dialogue: So let me get this straight, sister, you're saying Hudson Hawk is not willingly working for the Mayflowers but Kaplan and the Candy Bars are?

Dialogue: You got it.  Operation Deflower Mayflower is a bad joke and I'm the punchline.  I thought we were using the CIA to help us to get Mayflower, but really the CIA was using me to keep us away from Mayflower.

Dialogue: Oh, why couldn't I be the Cardinal in charge of catering.... If the Mayflowers get the three sections of Da Vinci's crystal and his instructions for the gold machine-- Aie-yi--Do we got anything?  What of Alex, Hawk's friend, where is his loyalty?

Dialogue: Alchemy!  Is the business term of the 90's, my man!  Minerva read about it in an airline magazine about four years ago.  I dumped some lira into research... Shazam, we come across a diary by one of Da Vinci's apprentices detailing La Machine de Oro, the gold machine for those at home, and the rest is about to become history.  Money isn't everything, gold is.  Fuck blue chip stocks!  Fuck T-bills! Fuck Junk Bonds!  I got the real deal!  Money will always be paper but gold will always be gold!

Dialogue: Market crashes.  Bomb drops. Greenhouse effect affects.  We'll still be the richest, most powerful people in the world.  In 1992, Europe is coming together to become one business superpower.  It's one party we'd love to poop.

This Gates-Mario Brothers-CIA-Mayflower-Da Vinci thing seemed like a sweet deal. Visit foreign lands, take their treasures.  I don't know, I thought you'd get into it.  It's better than playing darts with M.B.A.'s at the bar.  I didn't know it was going to be like this.  Them using me to use you... I'm sorry, there's only one way out of this and it's gonna hurt me more than it's gonna hurt you.

Brokers, economists, and fellow entrepreneurs will drown in the saliva of their own nervous breakdowns.  Markets will crash- crash.  Financial Empires will crumble-crumble.

It's a natural inclination.  But for I, this isn't a fantasy, it is reality! You are on my planet!  You walk around the corner for coffee, out of my sight, you do not fucking exist!  The lives of shmoes like you have meaning only in relation to the rich, to the powerful, to ME!
